stimulusHtml:
• Moving from left to right.
    • The curve begins slightly to the left of a minimum point (negative 1 comma negative 3).
    • The curve passes through the following points with coordinates:
      • (negative 1 comma negative 3)
      • (0 comma negative 2)
      • (1 comma 0)
      • (2 comma 2)
      • (3 comma 3), a maximum point
      • (4 comma 2)
      • (5 comma 0)
      • (6 comma negative 2)
      • (7 comma negative 3), a minimum point
      • (8 comma negative 2)
      • (9 comma 0)
      • (10 comma 2)
      • (11 comma 3), a maximum point
      • (12 comma 2)
      • (13 comma 0)
      • (14 comma negative 2)
      • (15 comma negative 3), a minimum point
      • (16 comma negative 2)
      • (17 comma 0)
    • The curve ends slightly to the right of the point (17 comma 0).

The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal function g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. What are the values of the period and amplitude of g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?
choicesHtml: ​The period is 4{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, and the amplitude is 3{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.
​​The period is 8{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, and the amplitude is 3{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.
​​The period is 4{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, and the amplitude is 6{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.
​​​The period is 8{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, and the amplitude is 6{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.
